intro: Torenia diffusa, commonly known as the common torenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring trailing stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces striking, tubular, violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Torenia diffusa is known for its ability to bloom continuously throughout the growing season, adding vibrant color to gardens and landscapes.
